ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned how to model CAD designs, manufacturing, and some coding
I learned all about the capabilities of Solidworks and all of the analysis tools available.
General introduction to Solidworks, projection math, and FEA.
Solid overview of the whole Solidworks CAE, with CADing, static and flow simulation, basic CAM generation, and their applications.
You'll learn a lot of good SolidWorks analysis which you will surely use if you go into industry.
Learned basics of CAD modeling in Solidworks

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The psets frequently asked us to use SolidWorks features that had not been (and were never) covered in class, while lectures were focused on the history of graphics and different simulations. More focus on actual "how-to" in SolidWorks would have drastically improved this class
Some homework assignments were very long, the grading was ambiguous and sometimes unclear.
The course does a great job of going through all of the analysis that can be done on Solidworks. We did examples in class and built off of that for the homeworks.
The course is consistent and the assignments provide practical application of the topics from lecture.  That being said, the lectures themselves can be somewhat slow or dull.

Well structured and paced classes with engaging assignments helping reviewing the material. It can be a bit difficult to gain intuition for why we do certain steps without more background in Solidworks.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this to other students. The skills I learned from this class were very useful and very interesting. It was a great elective for me, and I think any engineering student would enjoy it.

Frankly, most of the Solidworks topics can be learned from tutorials online, but some of the simulation specifics were very helpful.  The other subjects were interesting and the homework was manageable.  I would recommend the course, although it can be competitive to get into it.
If you aren't already very comfortable with SolidWorks (or some other CAD program) analysis techniques, this is a must take for anyone going into engineering after college
